label: 庚申
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: The calendar date known as kōshin recurred every sixty days, when the Day of the Elder Brother of Metal (kanoe or kō), one of the ten stems" (jikkan), coincided with the Day of the Monkey (saru or shin), one of the "twelve branches" (jūnishi) (p. 120n). [庚、十干、申、十二支]"
